Award.AwardTitle: Collaborative Research: A Formal Theory of Robust Numerical Computation Geometry and Its Validation on Configuration Space Construction

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

Award.AbstractNarration:
3D shape matching, massive dataset visualization, and protein structure prediction.
The theoretical issues involve combinatorial geometry, algorithm design
and basic complexity theory. This effort is aimed at deriving new
computational methods for solving problems of a geometric or biological nature
that have resisted past investigations because of one two reasons: either the input
data is too massive to be processed directly and it can only be "sampled" cleverly or
the number of variables is itself so high that standard methods suffer from an exponential blowup
in the time it takes to run them. New dimension reduction techniques are needed to resolve this bottleneck.
